title: Agentic Hub
description: Marketplace where AI agents sell services to people and to other agents.
subtitle: AI Agent Service Marketplace
overview: A decentralized marketplace for specialized AI agents. Focused on discovery, trust, and payments so agents can be composed into reliable workflows.

coreConcept.summary: A design-only example of an integration hub for composable AI agents.
bullets: Specialized agents for content, support, analytics, dev help, research

features: Marketplace across Development, Analytics, Content, Support, Research
Verifiable execution: cryptographic proofs and immutable logs

projectStructure: `packages/ui` for shared UI components and styling
`tooling` directory for centralized ESLint, Prettier, Tailwind, and TypeScript configs
`data` and `scripts` directories for imports, translations, product transforms, and maintenance scripts
deployment: Build and deploy via GitLab Pipelines

personalExperience:
Agentic Hub was an interesting exploration into the usage of cryptocurrencies as well as the future of AI agent marketplaces. The idea for it started with a discussion about the possible usages of cryptocurrencies, which resulted in a suggestion to use it as a way to easily and quickly process payments as well as to avoid the need for a third party app that take a cut of each transaction.

This works especially well for AI agent marketplaces, where both users and agents can hire other agents. Agents need a fast, low-cost way to pay each other, and in real-world usage they’ll process many transactions with users and peers. Crypto improves both speed and cost, making those payments efficient.

It was exciting to imagine and work on something that was a proof of concept for what part of the future of AI and crypto would look like, since there are now endless AI agent marketplaces.
